Content.Text:
<FACE_KAMONBERU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Klaus is muttering about something to
himself. I don't really know why, but I
think he's worried about something.

<FACE_KUROZE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I wouldn't say I'm worried. I was just
eating some macaroni the other day, and
I noticed the hole in it.
<PAGE>
Macaroni has a hole in it... why? Why
must it have that hole?
<PAGE>
This has been keeping me up at night.

<FACE_KAMONBERU><POS_LEFT><FACE_SAD>
He's been muttering like that for hours
now.

<FACE_KAMONBERU><POS_LEFT><FACE_SAD>
Klaus, it's macaroni because it has a
hole in it. That's what makes it
macaroni!

<FACE_KUROZE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I need hear nothing more from you. I'm
wondering the fundamental reason why the
macaroni has a hole in it.
<PAGE>
I started by considering boiling time.
Having a hole in it makes it boil
faster. I quickly proved that fact.
<PAGE>
Then I considered how it feels to eat
it. The softness when you bite, then
cutting through with your teeth.
<PAGE>
You can enjoy that lovely softness, so
chewy, so perfect.
<PAGE>
You can even hold it between your teeth
and suck in air through it like a straw.
<PAGE>
All of this makes it the ultimate in
food, surely! And the hole is vital to
achieve this!

<FACE_KUROZE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Then, I turned to consideration of
the flavor. The flavor of macaroni is 
determined by the sauce.
<PAGE>
When you mix macaroni with the sauce, it
always gets inside that hole. This is a
vital point! Maybe the key point!
<PAGE>
You get the flavor coming out from
inside the macaroni as you eat it. This
is one of its principle characteristics!
<PAGE>
Next, appearance. Do you look upon 
macaroni without giving it any thought?
I am sure you do.
<PAGE>
You don't even see it, I'm sure. That's
just normal. Isn't it?
<PAGE>
But have you never thought you might
like to peer into the hole in that
macaroni?

<FACE_KUROZE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
We mortals are a bundle of curiosity.
If we see a hole then how can we resist
peering into it?
<PAGE>
Of course, this also applies to the hole
in macaroni! The problem here is that
macaroni is bent.
<PAGE>
That means you can't see anything even
if you do try to peer down it. Which
just means you want to see it even more.
<PAGE>
That means you end up trying to stretch
it out and see the other side.
<PAGE>
Finally, finally, you see through it...
and such relief sets in!

<FACE_KUROZE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
As you can see, the holes in macaroni
therefore also fulfill a visual need.
<PAGE>
And this ultimately brings me back to my
original question of just why does 
macaroni have to have a hole?

<FACE_KAMONBERU><POS_LEFT><FACE_SAD>
For all of those reasons, surely? Isn't
everything you've just said the reason
why macaroni has a hole?

<FACE_KAMONBERU><POS_LEFT><FACE_ANGRY>
That's right.
<PAGE>
Cooking time, texture, flavor,
appearance... these are all the
characteristics of macaroni.

<FACE_KUROZE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ROUGH>
I see... I see! All of them are the
result of the hole in the macaroni!
<PAGE>
It truly is the ultimate food!

<FACE_KAMONBERU><POS_LEFT><FACE_SAD>
I'm still not sure why you're so
excited. You're exaggerating things,
as usual.

<FACE_KUROZE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
So how does the hole in macaroni stay
open?
<PAGE>
I started by looking at the dough from
which it is made...

<FACE_KAMONBERU><POS_LEFT><FACE_ANGRY>
O-Okay! You can tell me the rest another
time!
<PAGE>
That's enough for today, please.

<FACE_KUROZE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Very well. We had a good session today.
<PAGE>
I'll take your comments about the hole
in macaroni onboard, Clement.
<PAGE>
I look forward to our next debate...
